Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2009 11:25AM eternaloptimism wrote: I had a lumpectomy and SNB. I was back to work 4 days later. I did have a bit of discomfort for a week or two after, but was able to do "everyday" activities. I did lift things around the house, but should not have........I think this prolonged my recovery. I know you will want to get back to normal asap, but remember to just take it easy. Since your parents will be helping, let them take the kids out and let you rest. Take advantage of down time. You deserve it. Good luck and warm wishes are being sent your way.
Posts.Title: How long recovery from lumpectomy? Anxiousmama RMlulu

Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2009 05:38AM eternaloptimism wrote: Does feeling / sensations return in the skin? I was told by my PS that I won't have feeling after mastectomy. If you have nipple sparing, do you have sensation in your nipples? I am trying to figure out what is more common......or "normal", if that's possible. Thanks.
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2009 07:35PM eternaloptimism wrote: I am new to this, deciding which surgeons to use, and am curious what the "average" time is between mastectomy and reconstruction. I am most likely going to go up one cup size. I believe I misunderstood time frames and need clarification on what to expect. I have my ups and downs (as we all do), and am getting very nervous. Thanks in advance. It is so extremely helpful to know there are so many of us going through this..........together!
